resources.string: "Tetriminos" are game pieces shaped like tetrominoes, geometric shapes composed of four blocks each. A random sequence of Tetriminos fall down the playing field. The objective of the game is to manipulate these Tetriminos, by moving each one sideways (if the player feels the need) and rotating it by 90 degree units, with the aim of creating a horizontal line of units without gaps. When such a line is created, it disappears, and any block above the deleted line will fall. As the game progresses, each level causes the Tetriminos to fall faster, and the game ends when the stack of Tetriminos reaches the top of the playing field and no new Tetriminos are able to enter. (с)Wikipedia

You can move the figure by moving your finger across the screen and with buttons on the right side of the screen.
Short press: figure will rotated by 90 degrees ;
Long press: pause.
<html> In each game type second row is painted in yellow. Arrows show offset blocks after removing of the bottom line.</html>

Game contains 3 types of field\'s grid
Classic: a rectangular vertical grid;
Awry: rectangular grid, inclined at 45 degrees;
Hex: hexagonal grid.
Figure below shows a possible situation in the awry game. You would think that the cell 1 is delayed in the field 2, because it will be keep by filled blocks on two sides of 2      However, it is not. Since cell 3 under 2 is not busy then 1 passes \"through\" 2 and stops in 3
<html> Game starts by 1 level. When a certain number of lines are cleared, the game enters a new level. Figure\'s pace and points for deleting row is increased in each next level.</html>

Points are awarded for each deleted line. Number of points for one line depends on the level of play and difficulty settings. There are two ways to change the difficulty: add \"Mischievous figures\" or increase starting pace. You can do it in section Setting-> Set complexity
To changing background go to Setting-> Set Background and select picture. To return the monotonous blue background, in section Settings press Default settings.

\"Mischievous figures\" are additional figures falling on the field. You can\'t move it, and they may shift and rotate. They can be in two states: distract and prevent. In the \"distract\" state they do not affect the game, only distracting the player.
In the \"prevent\" state, when they reach the bottom of the field, they remain, and they can also interfere with the movement of the main figure. The disturbing figures fall rare, more often, the more their number
To changing number or color or state of \"Mischievous figures\" go to Setting-> Set complexity. Do not forget to confirm the changes by pressing Save buttons.
To changing starting pace go to Setting-> Set complexity. Do not forget to confirm the changes by pressing Save button.
Default settings are: blue background, no \"mischievous figures\" and first starting pace. To setting default settings go to Setting-> Default settings.
